description: Variable symbol generation for orders - Replace hardcoded '123456' with order number from SimpleShop API
steps: Step 1: Navigate to paid product page as a logged-in user
Step 2: Fill in order details and submit order
Step 3: Verify that variable symbol in the order matches order number (not hardcoded '123456')
Step 4: For SimpleShop-initiated orders, verify order number is taken from SimpleShop API
Step 5: Check database orders table to confirm variable_symbol column is populated correctly

description: SimpleShop API validation before order confirmation
steps: Step 1: Navigate to paid product order page
Step 2: Submit order with product data
Step 3: Verify that system validates order data against SimpleShop API before confirmation
Step 4: Test with invalid product ID and verify proper error message
Step 5: Test with valid product and verify successful validation
Step 6: Check logs for SimpleShop API communication

description: Order state update to SHIPPED when product is downloaded or sent
steps: Step 1: Create a test order with CONFIRMED state
Step 2: Download the product from the order
Step 3: Verify order state is automatically updated to SHIPPED
Step 4: Check database to confirm state change is persisted
Step 5: Verify state change is visible in admin order list
Step 6: For free products, verify state changes on confirmation

description: Paid time tracking for orders when payment is confirmed
steps: Step 1: Check database schema for paid_time column in orders table
Step 2: Create new order and mark as paid
Step 3: Verify paid_time timestamp is recorded
Step 4: View order in admin and verify paid_time is displayed
Step 5: Test that paid_time remains null for unpaid orders

description: Payment method and admin notes fields added to orders
steps: Step 1: Check database schema for payment_method and notes columns in orders table
Step 2: Create order via SimpleShop and verify payment_method is populated
Step 3: View order in admin interface
Step 4: Add admin notes to order and save
Step 5: Reload order and verify notes are persisted
Step 6: Verify payment_method displays correct value (e.g., 'card', 'transfer')

description: Automatic subscription to final mailing group when product is paid
steps: Step 1: Configure product with mailing_group_id
Step 2: User purchases product and payment is confirmed
Step 3: Verify user is automatically subscribed to the product's mailing group
Step 4: Check MailerLite API logs for subscription request
Step 5: Verify subscription only happens once payment is confirmed, not on order creation
Step 6: Test with user already in group - verify no duplicate subscription error

description: Order history view for users in member section
steps: Step 1: Login as member user with past orders
Step 2: Navigate to member section
Step 3: Find and click on 'Order History' or 'My Orders' link
Step 4: Verify all user's orders are listed with order number, date, products, and status
Step 5: Click on an order to see detailed view
Step 6: Verify order details include items, prices, payment status, and download links for paid products
Step 7: Test with user who has no orders - verify appropriate empty state message
Step 8: Verify pagination if user has many orders

description: Pagination for user administration list
steps: Step 1: Login as admin
Step 2: Navigate to user administration (/admin/users)
Step 3: Verify pagination controls are present (Previous, Next, page numbers)
Step 4: Verify default page size (e.g., 20 users per page)
Step 5: Navigate to next page and verify different users are shown
Step 6: Change page size and verify correct number of users displayed
Step 7: Verify total user count is displayed
Step 8: Test edge cases: first page, last page, single page

description: Password strength validation using zxcvbn library
steps: Step 1: Navigate to password setup or change password page
Step 2: Enter weak password (e.g., 'password123')
Step 3: Verify real-time password strength indicator appears using zxcvbn
Step 4: Verify strength levels: weak, medium, strong with visual feedback
Step 5: Enter strong password and verify it's accepted
Step 6: Verify helpful suggestions for improving weak passwords
Step 7: Test form submission - weak passwords should be rejected with clear message

description: Password match validation in password setup form
steps: Step 1: Navigate to password setup form (new user or password recovery)
Step 2: Enter password in first field
Step 3: Enter different password in confirmation field
Step 4: Verify real-time validation error: 'Passwords do not match'
Step 5: Update confirmation to match and verify error disappears
Step 6: Submit form with matching passwords and verify success
Step 7: Test submission with mismatched passwords - should be rejected

description: User activity log for product downloads, purchases, orders, member logins and actions
steps: Step 1: Check database for user_activity_log table with proper schema
Step 2: Login as member and verify login action is logged
Step 3: Download a free product and verify download action is logged
Step 4: Create an order and verify order creation is logged
Step 5: Complete payment and verify payment action is logged
Step 6: Download paid product and verify download is logged
Step 7: Perform various member section actions and verify they are logged
Step 8: Login as admin and view user activity log
Step 9: Verify log entries include: timestamp, user_id, action_type, entity_type, entity_id, IP address
Step 10: Test filtering log by user, date range, and action type
Step 11: Verify log entries are properly indexed for performance

description: Account deletion with GDPR compliance
steps: Step 1: Login as member user
Step 2: Navigate to account settings or profile page
Step 3: Find 'Delete My Account' option
Step 4: Click delete and verify confirmation dialog appears
Step 5: Confirm deletion with password verification
Step 6: Verify user data is deleted or anonymized according to GDPR
Step 7: Verify user cannot login after deletion
Step 8: Verify orders and comments are preserved but user info is anonymized
Step 9: Verify email is sent confirming account deletion
Step 10: Test as admin - verify deleted user appears in audit log

description: Pagination for order administration list
steps: Step 1: Login as admin
Step 2: Navigate to order administration (/admin/orders)
Step 3: Verify pagination controls are present
Step 4: Verify default page size (e.g., 20 orders per page)
Step 5: Navigate between pages and verify different orders shown
Step 6: Change page size and verify display updates
Step 7: Verify total order count is displayed
Step 8: Test sorting by order date, status, order number while paginated

description: Pagination for product administration list
steps: Step 1: Login as admin
Step 2: Navigate to product administration (/admin/products)
Step 3: Verify pagination controls are present
Step 4: Verify default page size for products
Step 5: Navigate between pages
Step 6: Change page size and verify display
Step 7: Verify total product count
Step 8: Test sorting while paginated

description: Pagination for category administration list
steps: Step 1: Login as admin
Step 2: Navigate to category administration (/admin/categories)
Step 3: Verify pagination controls are present
Step 4: Navigate between pages
Step 5: Change page size
Step 6: Verify total category count
Step 7: Test with small number of categories (< page size)

description: Advanced search and filtering in admin lists
steps: Step 1: Login as admin and navigate to user administration
Step 2: Use search box to filter users by login or email
Step 3: Verify real-time search results update
Step 4: Apply filters (e.g., by role: ADMIN, MEMBER)
Step 5: Combine search with filters
Step 6: Navigate to order administration
Step 7: Search orders by order number or user
Step 8: Filter by order state (CREATED, CONFIRMED, SHIPPED)
Step 9: Filter by date range
Step 10: Navigate to product administration
Step 11: Search products by title or slug
Step 12: Verify pagination works with search/filters active
Step 13: Test clearing filters returns to full list

description: Admin email notifications for important events (new orders, spam detection)
steps: Step 1: Configure admin notification email in application config
Step 2: Create a new order as a customer
Step 3: Verify admin receives email notification about new order
Step 4: Submit a comment that triggers spam detection
Step 5: Verify admin receives email notification about spam comment
Step 6: Verify email contains relevant details (order number, user info, etc.)
Step 7: Check that notification preferences can be configured (which events trigger emails)
Step 8: Test notification when order payment is confirmed
Step 9: Verify multiple admins can receive notifications if configured

description: Category caching by articles for performance optimization
steps: Step 1: Navigate to blog homepage or article listing
Step 2: Verify categories are loaded efficiently (check logs for cache hits)
Step 3: Load multiple articles and verify categories are cached
Step 4: Update a category in admin
Step 5: Verify cache is properly invalidated after category update
Step 6: Reload article and verify updated category is displayed
Step 7: Monitor database query count - should decrease with caching active
Step 8: Test cache warming on application startup
Step 9: Test cache eviction policy under memory pressure

description: Google API constants moved to application configuration
steps: Step 1: Review code to verify no hardcoded Google API consumer keys or secrets
Step 2: Check application.yml for google.api.consumerKey and google.api.consumerSecret
Step 3: Verify GoogleApiAuth service reads from configuration
Step 4: Test Google Docs integration with configured credentials
Step 5: Verify application fails gracefully if credentials are missing
Step 6: Test with different environments (local, production)

description: Validation for Google OAuth authorization code input
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Google Docs integration in admin
Step 2: Start OAuth flow to get authorization code
Step 3: Enter malformed authorization code
Step 4: Verify proper validation error message
Step 5: Enter empty code and verify validation
Step 6: Enter valid code format and verify acceptance
Step 7: Test with expired code and verify appropriate error handling

description: Token refresh mechanism for expired Google credentials
steps: Step 1: Set up Google Docs integration with valid credentials
Step 2: Wait for access token to expire or manually expire it
Step 3: Attempt to sync article from Google Docs
Step 4: Verify system automatically refreshes token using refresh token
Step 5: Verify sync succeeds after token refresh
Step 6: Check logs for token refresh events
Step 7: Test when refresh token is also expired - verify re-authentication prompt
Step 8: Verify user is notified when re-authentication is needed

description: Google Analytics integration for tracking
steps: Step 1: Configure Google Analytics tracking ID in application config
Step 2: Navigate to public pages of the site
Step 3: Verify Google Analytics tracking script is present in page source
Step 4: Verify tracking code is placed correctly in <head> or before </body>
Step 5: Check Google Analytics dashboard for page views
Step 6: Test tracking of custom events (article views, product views, orders)
Step 7: Verify admin pages exclude tracking or use separate property
Step 8: Test that tracking respects user cookie consent settings
Step 9: Verify tracking works in production but can be disabled for local development

description: Google Search Console integration for SEO monitoring
steps: Step 1: Configure Google Search Console API credentials in application
Step 2: Implement service to fetch search performance data
Step 3: Create admin page for viewing Search Console metrics
Step 4: Verify metrics display: impressions, clicks, CTR, average position
Step 5: Test filtering by date range
Step 6: View top performing pages and queries
Step 7: Check for indexing issues and display in admin
Step 8: Verify sitemap submission status
Step 9: Test error handling when Search Console API is unavailable
Step 10: Verify data caching to avoid excessive API calls

description: Keyboard shortcuts for power users in admin interface
steps: Step 1: Login as admin
Step 2: Press '?' to display keyboard shortcuts help overlay
Step 3: Test 'Ctrl+N' or 'Cmd+N' to create new article
Step 4: Test 'Ctrl+S' or 'Cmd+S' to save current form
Step 5: Test 'Ctrl+E' to toggle edit mode
Step 6: Test 'Esc' to close modals or cancel operations
Step 7: Test arrow keys for navigation in lists
Step 8: Test '/' to focus search box
Step 9: Verify shortcuts work consistently across different admin pages
Step 10: Verify shortcuts don't interfere with form inputs
Step 11: Test on different browsers and operating systems

description: Accessibility improvements - ARIA labels and screen reader support
steps: Step 1: Use accessibility audit tool (e.g., axe, Lighthouse) on homepage
Step 2: Verify all images have alt text or ARIA labels
Step 3: Verify form inputs have associated labels or aria-label attributes
Step 4: Test navigation with screen reader (NVDA, JAWS, or VoiceOver)
Step 5: Verify all interactive elements are keyboard accessible
Step 6: Check that focus indicators are visible when navigating by keyboard
Step 7: Verify semantic HTML is used (nav, main, article, aside, etc.)
Step 8: Test that ARIA roles are properly assigned for complex widgets
Step 9: Verify color contrast meets WCAG AA standards
Step 10: Test with screen reader on article pages, forms, and admin interface
Step 11: Verify error messages are announced to screen readers
Step 12: Test landmark navigation with screen reader

description: Comment notifications for article authors
steps: Step 1: Enable comment notifications in configuration
Step 2: Create article as a specific author with email
Step 3: As a different user, submit a comment on the article
Step 4: Verify article author receives email notification about new comment
Step 5: Verify email contains comment text, commenter name, and link to article
Step 6: Test notification preferences - author can opt out of notifications
Step 7: Submit reply to existing comment and verify original commenter is notified
Step 8: Test that spam comments do not trigger notifications until approved
Step 9: Verify notifications work for multiple authors if article has co-authors

description: Comment search functionality in administration
steps: Step 1: Login as admin and navigate to comments administration
Step 2: Enter search term in comment search box
Step 3: Verify comments containing search term are displayed
Step 4: Test search by commenter name
Step 5: Test search by email
Step 6: Test search by comment content
Step 7: Filter comments by state (approved, waiting, spam)
Step 8: Combine search with filters
Step 9: Test date range filtering
Step 10: Verify search works with pagination
Step 11: Test search performance with large number of comments

description: Media library search and filtering enhancements
steps: Step 1: Login as admin and navigate to media library
Step 2: Enter filename in search box and verify matching media files appear
Step 3: Filter by content type (image, pdf, etc.)
Step 4: Filter by date uploaded (date range)
Step 5: Filter by file size range
Step 6: Test sorting by filename, date, size
Step 7: Combine multiple filters
Step 8: Test search with partial filename matches
Step 9: Verify thumbnail previews for images
Step 10: Test pagination in media library
Step 11: Verify private vs public media filtering

description: Database performance audit and index optimization
steps: Step 1: Review create_tables.sql for existing indexes
Step 2: Identify slow queries using database query logs or profiling
Step 3: Add missing indexes based on common query patterns
Step 4: Test query performance before and after index additions
Step 5: Verify index on orders(paid_time) if paid_time filtering is common
Step 6: Verify composite indexes for common filter combinations
Step 7: Check for N+1 query problems in article-category loading
Step 8: Verify indexes exist for all foreign keys
Step 9: Test performance of admin list pages with large datasets
Step 10: Monitor index usage and identify unused indexes
Step 11: Run EXPLAIN ANALYZE on critical queries to verify index usage
Step 12: Add indexes to user_activity_log table for common query patterns

description: Order history view UI design in member section
steps: Step 1: Login as member with order history
Step 2: Navigate to order history page
Step 3: Take screenshot of order list view
Step 4: Verify responsive design on mobile, tablet, desktop
Step 5: Verify order cards/rows have clear visual hierarchy
Step 6: Verify status badges use appropriate colors (green for shipped, yellow for pending, etc.)
Step 7: Verify download buttons are prominently displayed for shipped orders
Step 8: Check spacing, typography consistency with rest of site

description: Pagination controls visual design and consistency
steps: Step 1: View user administration with pagination
Step 2: Take screenshot of pagination controls
Step 3: Verify pagination matches Bootstrap design system
Step 4: Test on mobile - verify responsive design
Step 5: Verify current page is clearly highlighted
Step 6: Verify disabled state for first/last pages
Step 7: Check hover states for clickable page numbers
Step 8: Verify consistent pagination design across all admin lists

description: Password strength indicator visual feedback
steps: Step 1: Navigate to password setup page
Step 2: Start typing password and observe strength indicator
Step 3: Take screenshots of weak, medium, strong states
Step 4: Verify color coding: red for weak, yellow for medium, green for strong
Step 5: Verify progress bar or meter visual representation
Step 6: Verify helpful text explains current strength level
Step 7: Verify suggestions appear for improving password
Step 8: Test on mobile devices for touch-friendly design

description: Admin notification emails design and formatting
steps: Step 1: Trigger new order notification email
Step 2: Review email in inbox (or use email testing tool)
Step 3: Verify email has professional HTML design
Step 4: Verify email includes logo and branding
Step 5: Verify important information is highlighted
Step 6: Test email rendering in multiple email clients
Step 7: Verify mobile-responsive email design
Step 8: Check spam score of notification emails
Step 9: Verify plain text fallback version exists

description: Keyboard shortcuts help overlay design
steps: Step 1: Press '?' in admin interface to show shortcuts help
Step 2: Take screenshot of help overlay
Step 3: Verify modal is centered and properly sized
Step 4: Verify shortcuts are organized by category
Step 5: Verify keyboard key representations are clear (e.g., 'Ctrl+S')
Step 6: Verify close button is easily accessible
Step 7: Verify overlay background dims the content below
Step 8: Test on different screen sizes

description: Accessibility - Focus indicators visibility
steps: Step 1: Navigate site using Tab key
Step 2: Verify focus outline is visible on all interactive elements
Step 3: Verify focus indicator has sufficient contrast
Step 4: Take screenshots showing focus states on buttons, links, inputs
Step 5: Verify custom focus styles match design system
Step 6: Test in high contrast mode
Step 7: Verify focus order is logical and intuitive

description: Comment search and filter UI in admin
steps: Step 1: Navigate to comments administration
Step 2: Take screenshot of search and filter interface
Step 3: Verify search box is prominently placed
Step 4: Verify filter dropdowns are clearly labeled
Step 5: Verify applied filters are visible with clear indicators
Step 6: Verify clear/reset filters button is accessible
Step 7: Test responsive design on smaller screens

description: Media library enhanced UI with search and filters
steps: Step 1: Navigate to media library in admin
Step 2: Take screenshot of grid/list view
Step 3: Verify thumbnail images display correctly
Step 4: Verify file metadata (name, size, date) is readable
Step 5: Verify search box is prominent
Step 6: Verify filter controls are intuitive
Step 7: Test view toggle (grid vs list) if available
Step 8: Verify responsive design for mobile media management
Step 9: Verify loading states for images

description: Google Search Console metrics dashboard UI
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Search Console integration page in admin
Step 2: Take screenshot of metrics dashboard
Step 3: Verify charts and graphs are clear and readable
Step 4: Verify metrics use appropriate visualizations (line charts for trends, etc.)
Step 5: Verify color scheme is consistent with admin design
Step 6: Verify date range picker is user-friendly
Step 7: Verify loading states for data fetching
Step 8: Test responsive design on different screen sizes

description: User profile editing capability verification for members
steps: Step 1: Login as member user
Step 2: Navigate to profile or account settings page
Step 3: Verify user can edit first name, last name, email
Step 4: Make changes and save
Step 5: Reload page and verify changes are persisted
Step 6: Test validation for invalid email format
Step 7: Test that login cannot be changed (or requires special verification)
Step 8: Verify password change link is available

description: Email verification flow for new user registrations verification
steps: Step 1: Register new user account
Step 2: Verify confirmation email is sent to provided address
Step 3: Check that user cannot login until email is verified
Step 4: Click verification link in email
Step 5: Verify user is redirected to success page
Step 6: Verify user can now login successfully
Step 7: Test expired verification link handling
Step 8: Test resending verification email
Step 9: Verify already-verified users can't verify again

description: Localization administration search functionality verification
steps: Step 1: Login as admin and navigate to localization administration
Step 2: Check if search box exists for filtering localization entries
Step 3: Enter search term and verify matching entries are displayed
Step 4: Test search by entry_key
Step 5: Test search by entry_value (translation text)
Step 6: Verify search is case-insensitive
Step 7: Test with special characters
Step 8: Verify pagination works with search active

description: End-to-end e-commerce flow with all enhancements
steps: Step 1: User browses product catalog
Step 2: User clicks on paid product
Step 3: User fills order form with valid data
Step 4: System validates order against SimpleShop API
Step 5: Order is created with proper variable symbol (not hardcoded)
Step 6: User is redirected to SimpleShop for payment
Step 7: User completes payment
Step 8: SimpleShop webhook notifies system of payment
Step 9: System updates order with paid_time and payment_method
Step 10: System subscribes user to product mailing group
Step 11: Admin receives email notification of new order
Step 12: User activity log records order creation and payment
Step 13: User navigates to member section order history
Step 14: User sees order with download link
Step 15: User downloads product
Step 16: System updates order state to SHIPPED
Step 17: User activity log records download
Step 18: Verify all data is correct in admin order view

description: Admin workflow efficiency with pagination and search
steps: Step 1: Login as admin with hundreds of users/orders/products
Step 2: Navigate to user administration
Step 3: Use search to quickly find specific user
Step 4: Verify search results appear in under 1 second
Step 5: Navigate to order administration
Step 6: Filter orders by state and date range
Step 7: Verify filtered results with pagination
Step 8: Navigate to product administration
Step 9: Search for product by name
Step 10: Verify all admin lists load quickly with pagination
Step 11: Test sorting combined with search and filters
Step 12: Verify page load times are under 2 seconds even with large datasets

description: Security and GDPR compliance comprehensive test
steps: Step 1: Verify password strength validation prevents weak passwords
Step 2: Create user account with strong password
Step 3: Verify password is hashed with PBKDF2 in database
Step 4: Test that SQL injection attempts are prevented in all forms
Step 5: Test XSS prevention in comment submission
Step 6: Verify CSRF tokens are present in all forms
Step 7: Test user can export their personal data
Step 8: Test user can delete their account
Step 9: Verify deleted user data is properly anonymized
Step 10: Verify activity logs record security-relevant events
Step 11: Test that admin cannot see user passwords (only reset them)
Step 12: Verify email verification prevents unauthorized access
